taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe astereae;genus aphanostephus;species skirrhobasis;variety kidderi

bio:treatment.description: Plants (10–)15–35 cm. Stems erect to decumbent, hirsuto-pilose and/or puberulent, hairs (0.2–)0.5–1.2 mm. Leaves not strongly thickened or felty gray-hairy. Ray florets 1–9–40. Pappi of acute or awn-tipped or setiform scales 0.4–2 mm. 2n = 6.
Sandy or gravelly soils, often in matorral and scrublands;
bio:treatment.discussion: Apparent intergrades between var. kidderi and var. skirrhobasis are relatively common. There is a greater tendency in Aphanostephus skirrhobasis for leaves to be lobed or pinnatifid over the whole stem than in the other species.
